Another example: a 50-year-old couple with a 25-year-old adult child making $85,533 per year currently pays $1,793 per month in premiums, or 25.15% of their income. Under this bill, they would pay $606 per month ‚Äî a savings of $14,246 a year.

Under this bill, no middle class family would pay more than 8.5% of their income for a silver plan in the health insurance marketplace. For a 40-year-old couple with two kids in Henrico making $103,258 per year, that means monthly premiums would go from $1,594 to $731.

The legislation I helped pass today received support from both Republicans and Democrats. The bipartisan bill would protect coverage for Americans with pre-existing conditions. It would also help lower healthcare costs for working families in #VA07. Here's how ‚Äî

Today, I voted to protect coverage for those with pre-existing conditions ‚Äî and I'll keep doing so as long as the Trump administration keeps trying to gut the coverage that millions of Virginians need to access lifesaving care for cancer, diabetes, & more.
